problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        # Ensure items fit within the box dimensions
        assert assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        # Ensure positions are non-negative (already bounded by Field, so redundant check omitted)

fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# Ensure all BoxAssignment records have consistent fields across variables
for i in range(1, 21):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        for j in range(i + 1, 21):
            # Only check items that are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Check for non-overlapping rectangles
                assert (
                    assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x or
                    assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x or
                    assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y or
                    assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y
                )

no_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# Ensure all BoxAssignment records have consistent fields across variables
for i in range(1, 21):
    assert item_box_assignments[i].box_id == x_y_positions[i].box_id
    assert item_box_assignments[i].x == x_y_positions[i].x
    assert item_box_assignments[i].y == x_y_positions[i].y

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, 21):
        # Ensure box_id is within valid range
        assert assignments[i].box_id >= 1
        assert assignments[i].box_id <= 20
        # Ensure coordinates are within box boundaries
        assert assignments[i].x >= 0
        assert assignments[i].x <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert assignments[i].y >= 0
        assert assignments[i].y <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Synchronize fields between assignments and positions
        assert assignments[i].box_id == positions[i].box_id
        assert assignments[i].x == positions[i].x
        assert assignments[i].y == positions[i].y

ensure_item_box_assignment_validity(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

# --- Objects ---


Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

BoxAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=20),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---

BOX_WIDTH : int = 100

    {"width": 11, "height": 79},
    {"width": 84, "height": 31},
    {"width": 18, "height": 91},
    {"width": 78, "height": 55},
    {"width": 27, "height": 87},
    {"width": 8, "height": 88},
    {"width": 40, "height": 68},
    {"width": 16, "height": 74},
    {"width": 54, "height": 53},
    {"width": 2, "height": 98},
    {"width": 24, "height": 88},
    {"width": 65, "height": 82},
    {"width": 45, "height": 92},
    {"width": 7, "height": 80},
    {"width": 79, "height": 23},
    {"width": 26, "height": 74},
    {"width": 47, "height": 35},
    {"width": 24, "height": 71},
    {"width": 76, "height": 75},
    {"width": 99, "height": 55}
]
nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=20):
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, 21):
        if assignments[i].box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = assignments[i].box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

):
    for i in range(1, 21):

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    box_width: int,
    box_height: int
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        pos_x: int = assignments[i].x
        pos_y: int = assignments[i].y

        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert pos_x + item_width <= box_width
        assert pos_y + item_height <= box_height

        # Ensure item does not have negative coordinates
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# Set fields of variables with same redundant fields equal
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert x_y_positions[i].box_id == item_box_assignments[i].box_id
    assert x_y_positions[i].x == item_box_assignments[i].x
    assert x_y_positions[i].y == item_box_assignments[i].y

    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # Assert that the rectangles do not overlap
                # They do not overlap if one is completely to the left, right, above, or below the other
                assert (assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x) or \
                       (assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x) or \
                       (assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y) or \
                       (assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y)

no_item_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions, BOX_WIDTH, BOX_HEIGHT)

# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # Check for non-overlap in x-axis
                x_non_overlap : DSBool() = (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x
                )
                # Check for non-overlap in y-axis
                y_non_overlap : DSBool() = (
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or
                    positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y
                )
                # Assert that at least one axis has non-overlap (i.e., no overlap)
                assert x_non_overlap or y_non_overlap

no_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

def ensure_item_assignment_correctness(
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
):
    # Each item must be assigned to exactly one box (already ensured by domain of assignments)
    # Positions must be within valid bounds (already constrained in previous constraints)
    # This function ensures consistency of assignment and positioning
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Item must be assigned to a valid box index
        assert assignments[i] >= 1
        assert assignments[i] <= 20
        # Position coordinates must be non-negative
        assert positions[i].x >= 0
        assert positions[i].y >= 0

ensure_item_assignment_correctness(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments : Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

# --- Objects ---


# Object type for an item with width and height
Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=100)
})

# Object type for the position (x, y) of an item within a box
Position = DSRecord({
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=100)
})

BOX_HEIGHT : int = 100
BOX_WIDTH : int = 100
ITEMS : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 11, "height": 79}, {"width": 84, "height": 31}, {"width": 18, "height": 91}, {"width": 78, "height": 55}, {"width": 27, "height": 87}, {"width": 8, "height": 88}, {"width": 40, "height": 68}, {"width": 16, "height": 74}, {"width": 54, "height": 53}, {"width": 2, "height": 98}, {"width": 24, "height": 88}, {"width": 65, "height": 82}, {"width": 45, "height": 92}, {"width": 7, "height": 80}, {"width": 79, "height": 23}, {"width": 26, "height": 74}, {"width": 47, "height": 35}, {"width": 24, "height": 71}, {"width": 76, "height": 75}, {"width": 99, "height": 55}]

nr_used_boxes : DSInt(lb=0, ub=20)
item_box_assignments : DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions : DSList(length=20, elem_type=Position)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> DSInt(lb=0, ub=20):
    max_box: DSInt(lb=0, ub=20) = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if assignments[i] > max_box:
            max_box = assignments[i]
    return max_box

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)
